text: Barry Clark Barish (born January 27, 1936) is an American experimental physicist and Nobel Laureate. He is a Linde Professor of Physics, emeritus at California Institute of Technology. He is a leading expert on gravitational waves, and is of Jewish descent.Oralhistories.library.caltech.edu In 2017, Barish was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics along with Rainer Weiss and Kip Thorne "for decisive contributions to the LIGO detector and the observation of gravitational waves". ==References== Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American physicists Category:Jewish American academics Category:Jewish American scientists Category:Jewish Nobel Prize winners Category:Scientists from Omaha, Nebraska Category:California Institute of Technology faculty Category:Educators from Omaha, Nebraska
title: Barry Barish
